reviewText: This is a great collection of the best of Saunders, very entertaining, i have always liked this show!
Quick delivery.  There are four episodes (3 good, 1 too sappy) of Combat all in B/W.

This series, in my opinion, was amoung the very best of the 60's.  Combat! has great storylines that follow American G.I.'s from Normandy and beyond.  Combat! provides excellent acting and great "edge of your seat" storylines.  Combat! was the very best TV Action/Drama on TV during the 60's. I highly reccomend Combat! to anyone that likes W. W. II.  You cannot go wrong buying this Series, it will not disappoint.
Better than I anticipated.  Vic Morrow was perfect as Sgt. Saunders.
If you grew up in the 60's then you need to get this DVD. Compare this so called "old show" to the new ones on TV. There is no comparision.

Back in the early 60's I was in the Air Force stationed at RAMSTEIN AFB, Germany...we had one tv station run by the military with limited programming and none live since satellite tv was not available...One of the favorite shows was Combat as it depicted the GI's in mostly France fighting the Germans...it was a good tool for trying to learn the language also...

Seeing those shows today I almost have to laugh at its simplicity but back then they were enjoyable entertainment for the troops...And they sure do bring back memories for a guy who was in his early 20's back then...
Excellent DVD for Combat fans. Vic Morrow (aka Saunders) was a good actor and even better director...I believe his best work in the series was directing "Hills are for Heroes)...

Sgt Saunders ( Vic Morrow) is the epitomey of the best example of a Sergeant during WW II . This video and all the Combat Videos are very worth the money if you like things pertaining to WW Ii and how the Army fought in France.
Watching this as a kid, all we saw was the action.  As an adult, we see the human drama in the episodes.  It's a great show, great price for this set.

A great show that I haven't seen in many years. I recently found a channel that replays the series and started watching again, problem is that it is on at 3 AM.  So I bought some of these for an emergency.
This gift was for my brother - he enjoyed it very much - would have liked to have gotten him more DVDs
If there was an actor who play a non-com better than any other actor , other than John Wayne, It would have to be Vic Morrow. He made his character beleivable and he made his notch in the profession.

I enjoyed Combat when I was a child. Vic Morrow was always my favorite on the show! This set is great, just
as I remembered it!! The only downside of this set, is that there is only 4 shows on it. There were so many
great Combat shows that featured Vic Morrow, it would have been tough to choose the best! This was a teaser
of Combat and makes you want the complete series. Well, I had to purchase the complete series after viewing
this DVD. If you liked the show and Vic Morrow as much as I do, I recommend that you purchase the complete
series now instead of this set. If you are just curious about the show, by all means, I recommemd this set!!

Many programs of the era had their own introductory music and this program was no exception; the music was by Leonard Rosseman.

They always start out with "staring Rick Jason and Vic Morrow." Instead of great sweeping epics this program focuses on a single squad with their trials and tribulation with confronting the Germans in WWII. Each episode is one hour and has to oppose a problem and a solution in that time. This was back in the time of professional privates.

In 1967-1968 Vietnam if you were lucky certain areas actually had TV broadcasting at 1600 hrs. You guessed it; this was one of the programs. I wonderer what the locals thought of the episode?

This would be a good series to own. Not just for the nostalgia, but the personal conflicts portrait in the program are still with us today.
Sgt. Chip Saunders in action; Vic Morrow took the role and ran away with it. He brought the harsh reality of war to life in this show!
disappointed.  i am and have been a Combat! fan for years...many years.  the collection of episodes contained only one that reminded me of why I loved this show...the other episodes sucked...
This movie shows the trials and tribulations of the true heros.

Combat! The Best of Saunders presents 4 great episodes including "The Little Carousel" (featuring an outstanding performance by a young Sylvianne Margolle) and "Anatomy of a Patrol" (featuring an outstanding performance by a young James Caan.)
good
Great Old Series.  Shipping was Fast.  No Regrets.
A TUFF GUY BUT DID HIS JOB..
good movie
